reviews.review: 360 them killers
топ игра

Great game, I've been playing it for quite a while over a long period of time. I'll definitely come back to it. But after this Hellraiser update, they need to seriously nerf some of the killers that are being abused by the community. It's become next to impossible to get away as a team, and killers are constantly baiting downed players and griefing by leaving everyone laying around at the end. They ruin it for everyone involved.

Sabotaged hooks keep popping back up afterwards, too. All kinds of shit's broken now.

Fix this update in some MAJOR ways, please. Don't ruin your own fucking game with some shitty updates just to appease the neck-beards that main killers all the time. Pinhead is absolutely breaking the game.

Once the issues with this new update are dealt with, I'm confident the game will balance out again. Don't let this shitty update ruin it for you; just means it's time to take a break until they actually get around to fixing their crap.
Do you dislike yourself? Get this game then. Its awesome

Honestly a decent game, bit of a learning curve, mainly because of the people you play with. Buggy beyond belief, but that's part of the charm. DLC's are mostly good, however they usually screw over console gamers, which don't seem to really matter to most people. Overall, the game makes you super pissed, but you still play it anyways.

BE你们什么时候能修复一下网络问题啊？你们这游戏为什么对网络要求这么高啊？稍微波动一下就直接给我拔了，然后还掉豆、罚站，怎么玩啊？就不能做一下重连的吗？平时都打着娱乐那都无所谓，最近想上个段，就那一颗豆给我疯狂卡着，上豆就掉线，从5段4颗给我直接掉到6段0颗豆，我这家里的网也不差啊，怎么到你这游戏里，就跟个2g似的呢？BE啊，我真的心态崩了你知不知道？现在玩游戏我走个路，修个机，甚至摸个人都心惊胆战的，就怕突然卡住，我都ptsd了。BE你告诉我，我玩个游戏，为什么这么痛苦啊？
人身在中国，只能玩外服，延迟本来就不低了，钢筋经常按不出来。按不出来就算了，怪我，是我没提前按，但是掉线真的我心态直接炸了。有一回就差一步就出门了的时候，我掉了。你猜我是什么感受？
我翻开历史一查，这历史没有年代，歪歪斜斜的每页都写着“we did a pretty good job”，我躺在床上，横竖睡不着，仔细想了半夜，才从字缝里看出字来，满本都写着一个词是“bug”！
This Dead By Daylight Game Is Very Good Keep It Up For Developers Dead By Daylight I Support This Game

A game so so heavily in favour of the killer. They are always faster than you, can teleport. You have to spend time cleansing totems and spend an eternity on generators. They can body block you, camp you on the hook, hit you till your downed and then not pick you up while others are downed so there is no chance of even escaping... You cant even play as a group of 5 with your friends (4 surv and 1 killer) and still earn bloodpoints you have to create custom game and not earn anything. Wish I could get a refund.

An asymmetric game of 4 survivors against 1 killer or 1 killer against 4 survivors depending on which side you may choose. This game is very fun to play and still has a growing audience and twitch presence. Best game of this genre, as well as frequently updated with new content. Now and again you may come across a toxic killer or survivor group but overall the community is positive, with everyone wishing each other a gg. Would 10/10 recommend this game, even nearing the end of 2021, as new content is released regularly and the inclusion of fun seasonal events make it hard to stop.

2. es sind viel zu viele haken auf den maps. die sind so nah aneinander das man sich gar nicht runterwigglen kann wenn man aufgehoben wurde...
3. das match making is fürn eimer. Du bekommst als low Rank einfach mal nen High Rank killer. so macht das doch alles spaß :D
Und alles andere fällt mir nicht ein...

I do not recommend this game in the current state. I've been playing this game for 5 years now and have enjoyed it. But the new Pinhead update had gone and made this game absolutely impossible to play as the survivor. New players are getting full game kills with the pinhead character. There is a puzzle box you have to solve or the chains will attach to you. But pinhead can teleport to the box, BUT ONLY if he isn't carrying someone which happens in such small time frames. He also gets his own chain he can use to navigate the map. So to make sure the chains don't attach to you, you spend more time trying to do the box then you do on generators so by the end of games with a pinhead killer, all survivors dead and none of the gen's done. Do not buy this game right now, wait till they fix how broken pinhead is

“四个坚持”的主要内容： 贯彻落实全面从严治[b]杀机[/b]的要求，[h1]《杀机》[/h1]改变了过去仅对[strike]蛇皮[/strike]级以上[u]大佬[/u]领导干部提要求的做法，将适用范围扩大到全体玩家和各级[u]大佬[/u]领导干部，紧扣如何保持廉洁本色，对全体玩家提出“四个坚持”的要求，是全体玩家廉洁自律的行为规范。

1、坚持[strike]在线四跑[/strike]，大佬去溜，小弟修机。这是要求处理好“溜与修”的关系。

2、坚持[strike]快蹲手电[/strike]，大佬被追，狂秀手电。这是要求处理好“追与秀”的关系。

3、坚持[strike]贴脸收尸[/strike]，大佬被挂，拉锯守尸。这是要求处理好“挂与守”的关系。

4、坚持[strike]倒地就拔[/strike]，大佬倒地，没亮就拔。这是要求处理好“倒与拔”的关系。

技术不够，高配来凑，屠夫被溜、大佬还秀、倒地就守、拔线贼⑥“四个坚持”为全体玩家设置了体验极差皮皇贼秀本色的道德标准，为各位玩家自我约束、自我监督和严格自律提供了一个具体、清晰的法规依据和执行标准。[spoiler][h1]

[h1] Recenzja Dead by Daylight. Gry wykonywania celów, symulatora biegania i gry w "berka". [/h1]

Miłośnikiem gier survivalowo-horrorowych nie jestem. Znajomi zachęcali mnie do zasmakowania rozgrywki w Dead by Daylight i udało im się mnie przekonać. Pierwsze podejścia traktowałem z dystansem, nie licząc, że zostanę przy grze na dłużej. Produkcja Behaviour Interactive z czasem również mnie przekonała, a wraz ze wzrostem godzin na moim profilu Steam, coraz bardziej mi się podobała.

[h1] Dla nowych graczy poprzeczka jest zawieszona wysoko. [/h1]

Początkujący gracze nie mają łatwo. Różnorodność map, różne ich wariacje potrafią narobić wiele kłopotów na początek. A przecież mapy tutaj to nie wszystko. Głównym celem Ocalałego jest naprawienie pięciu generatorów, a następnie otworzenie bram wyjściowych, po których może uciec. Jednak główne cele to nie całość, bo są jeszcze zadania poboczne, do których należy - między innymi -  ratowanie towarzyszy z haków, leczenie sprzymierzeńców czy niszczenie totemów znajdujących się w różnych miejscach na mapie. Zadania Zabójcy są przeciwieństwem zadań Ocalałych, ale mimo tego rozgrywka jest wciąż ciekawa zarówno po jednej, jak i drugiej stronie. Największym problemem może być podejmowanie decyzji w danej chwili ze względu na system umiejętności.

[h1] "Perki". [/h1]

Każda z postaci niezależnie od strony ma swoje unikalne umiejętności ułatwiające rozgrywkę. Niemniej nie są one dostępne od razu. Każdej z postaci trzeba wbijać poziom w specjalnym drzewku, gdzie pojawiają się również dodatki do przedmiotów. Maksymalny level to 50, po którym można zrobić tak zwany prestiż, po czym resetują się wszystkie perki i trzeba od nowa wszystko zbierać. Na godny uwagi zasługuje system, w jaki Behaviour Interactive opracowało na potrzeby drzewka umiejętności. Żeby wbić dany poziom, należy wydać "punkty krwi", które zyskujemy za wykonywanie celów podczas rozgrywki.

[h1] Rozgrywka warta przyjrzeniu się solo jak i ze znajomymi. [/h1]

Rozbudowany system perków, ciekawy gameplay i różnorodność map sprawia, że warto się przyjrzeć grze, jeśli lubicie wspólną rozgrywkę ze znajomymi czy też rozgrywkę z nieznajomymi ludźmi z Internetu. Druga opcja pozwoli zdobyć ciekawe doświadczenie, z którym będzie szła zachęta (czasami nawet przymus) współpracy przy kręceniu generatorów albo ratowaniu swoich tyłków nawzajem. 
Tak czy inaczej, Dead by Daylight jest grą, przy której jedni zostaną, lubiąc doświadczenie współpracy z randomami czy też ganiania się z najbardziej irytującymi Zabójcami, a drudzy odłożą ją na półkę swojej cyfrowej biblioteki.

[h1]Dee-Bee-Dee: Death is not an Escape, but DC'ing is.[/h1]

The Diary section of this review is in the comments section as part of the first 8 comments by me from bottom to top. But unlike my other reviews, I wanted to cut straight to the chase with this one cause there's so much I have to say about the game, whilst also keeping it within the word limit. Here's a list of Pros and Cons shuffled randomly, and it's your challenge to figure out which is a [i]pro[/i] and which is a [u]con:[/u]
[list]
    [*]The code is spaghetti, framerate plummets for no reason whatsoever, and Unreal's dynamic resolution scaling makes everything look blurry with most textures reduced to flat shaded colors.
    [*]Updating problems with the EAC client making trouble by requiring verification of file integrity after every update. Back in January, you had to do it manually and the game wouldn't tell you to do it cause it just kept failing to initialize. But now, Steam will force an automatic verification after every update, but you still have to go to the Downloads page and click something again... they couldn't just make it easy to auto-update, they just [i]had[/i] to bring up complications.
    [*]The game attracts a bit more of a toxic playerbase due to its horror nature and the insane amount of power it gives to a particular side with the help of strong items, add-ons, perks, etc. Getting [i]tilted[/i] is a given, it may be due to bugs, intentionally irritating survivors/teammates, or sometimes even because you're mad at yourself for making a bad play.
    [*]There are 3 different currencies: [u]Bloodpoints[/u], [u]Iridescent Shards[/u], and [u]Auric Cells[/u] which stand for your character progression, player progression, and store currencies respectively. The former 2 are given to you for free for playing the game, while Auric Cells are just your average paid in-game currency. Most games with a marketable currency however would cost the same globally so that trading items can be consistent (like Rocket League's [i]Credits[/i] for instance), but DBD doesn't have trading, and hence doesn't have to worry about an item economy. So Auric Cells also have [i]regional pricing[/i] much like the base game and its DLCs. So depending on which region it is, sometimes buying licensed characters may be cheaper whilst buying the DLC on Steam or vice versa in the in-game store.
    [*]The game is 100% pay-to-win and everyone knows it. But as long as you don't care about in-game cosmetics or the Season Pass (The Rift), you needn't be sucked into the Mtx model cause then you'll just need to spend $3 every 3 months when a new chapter comes out. Of course, you can use Iri Shards as mentioned above to buy the original Killers, but Steam DLCs on sale are relatively cheap with regional pricing so some of the playerbase can choose to pay for them if they want to avoid grinding/ collecting the DLCs on Steam.
    [*]Now the above-mentioned issue may seem to cause a disparity in the variety of killers you go against as a survivor, it's usually not the case in higher ranks since most good players own most of the characters and perks anyways. But it still brings up the question of whether this type of pay-to-win system should be acceptable in semi-balanced-semi-competitive games like this, but I don't consider this game as competitive nor balanced. I wouldn't want any multiplayer game to go the way of esports games, stripping their maps of any detail to run at 400+ fps. DBD's maps look amazing on a strong PC in terms of an RNG tile-based system for its map layouts. So I don't really mind being locked at 60fps as long as every map is gorgeous and detailed.
    [*][b]Fun.[/b] It was very exciting to get into the game in 2020 than in 2016, cause the game has probably changed so much since then. The game is definitely at its peak, no matter what the community or the legacy players think. There weren't as big a number of killers back then, there weren't so many maps and quality-of-life improvements as there are now. Bugs will be present in every live service game, especially when it updates with a new game-changing Killer, whose mechanics must work on every single map, its perks' effects to work alongside the other hundreds of killer and survivor perks, so it's nearly impossible for the balance of the game to be maintained without thorough testing before it releases on live servers. And that brings us to the PTBs:
    [*]PTBs require the same tedious updating process as a regular update, but takes even longer to switch back to Live, and doesn't give any reward for doing so, so most people pass on it. The devs call it a 'PTB', but all they're really doing is showing what they're up to, cause most of the time all the bugs from the PTB are transferred right along into the Live update even though hundreds of people noticed and complained about them in the PTB... so yeah... it's a complete waste of time.
    [*]On a controller (as a survivor) R1 does [b]EVERYTHING.[/b] I understand why this is (because you can't have your thumb on any of the face buttons to perform interactions cause then you're handicapped from moving the joystick to look around you), but there have been so many instances where I try to heal someone under a pallet and I end up dropping it and notifying the killer because the other survivor moved just a bit and my prompt for healing turned to 'Drop Pallet'. On a much rarer occasion (but still something that happens from time to time), I would be vacuumed into a gen repair or totem cleanse while I'm trying to vault a pallet in a chase...
    [*]The game's steep learning curve is not a con in my opinion. I agree at first it was difficult to properly communicate with others on VC when they kept using the community-made up lingo, but unlike the average playerbase, this game has a very dedicated community who care about the game more than just its cosmetics or items (cause there's no trading anyways). Unlike Rocket League, I've come to like every popular streamer who became big thanks to this game. For example, you could just keep listening to Otzdarva babble for 1 hour about perks and powers, and I'd slurp just slurp it all up.
    [*]New licenses added to Dead by Daylight feel more [b]substantial[/b] compared to in other games. Usually, when it comes to other games, they'll get a random media franchise license and a couple of cosmetics themed around it will be added in at most. But when Dead by Daylight releases a new [b]Chapter[/b], it's not just a new 'Season Pass' with a couple of cosmetics (although that exists as well), it's a complete game-changing phenomenon and they have to completely commit to the new license being part of their game and their ecosystem, it's not just some lazy marketing gimmick to please horror fans. They can't just add random licensed media, it [I]NEEDS[/i] to be from a horror franchise, and that makes the selective ecosystem the game has built for itself work without looking too goofy with a mix-up of too many varying styles. You can even call it [b]Adapting[/b] the source material into a game technically. [I]Although the existence of PTBs slightly ruins the excitement surrounding a new license reveal.[/i]
    [*]I would've stopped playing survivor soon enough if not for the HUD update which made skill-checks non-reliant on the system's framerate. Before this, hitting skill checks were really hard on my Dell Laptop that had less than optimal framerate, so the skill checks were stuttery and not satisfying to hit.
    [*]Spectating after dying feels more important, unlike other games/battle royales, cause the teammates that you've played with have made a mini-bond with you in the form of tea-bagging and pointing at your face.[/list]

[u]Check the comments for my opinion on:
Trapper, Wraith, Billy, Dwight, Meg, Claudia, and Jake.[/u]
